content: Which British author, best known for his fantasy novels about a hobbit named Bilbo Baggins, also served as a codebreaker during World War II?

I believe the author you're referring to is J.R.R. Tolkien. He is indeed famous for his fantasy novels, including "The Hobbit" and "The Lord of the Rings" series, which feature a character named Bilbo Baggins. Additionally, Tolkien worked as a codebreaker during World War I, not World War II. He was involved in cryptographic work for the British military during World War I, specifically in the development of codes and ciphers. So, while he did contribute to codebreaking efforts, it was during the earlier global conflict.
